class wp4.compare.models.core.BaseModelMixin(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Common data record fields for tracking changes

Parameters:
  • created_on (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “created on”
  • created_by_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “created by” - User account for the person logged in when this record was made/updated
created_by¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class Meta[source]¶
abstract = False¶
BaseModelMixin.save(created_by=None, force_insert=False, force_update=False, using=None, update_fields=None)[source]¶

Meta save function that allows models to have their save() method called, and to set the required created_by link at the same time.

class wp4.compare.models.core.OrganPerson(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Base attributes for a person involved in this case as a donor or recipient

Parameters:
  • id (django.db.models.AutoField) – “ID”
  • created_on (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “created on”
  • created_by_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “created by” - User account for the person logged in when this record was made/updated
  • version (django.db.models.PositiveIntegerField) – “version” - Internal tracking version number
  • record_locked (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “record locked” - Not presently implemented or used
  • number (django.db.models.CharField) – “OP01 NHSBT Number”
  • date_of_birth (django.db.models.DateField) – “OP02 date of birth” - Date can not be in the future
  • date_of_birth_unknown (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “date of birth unknown” - Internal unknown flag
  • date_of_death (django.db.models.DateField) – “OP08 date of death” - Date can not be in the future
  • date_of_death_unknown (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “date of death unknown” - Internal unknown flag
  • gender (django.db.models.CharField) – “OP03 gender”
  • weight (django.db.models.DecimalField) – “OP04 Weight (kg)” - Answer must be in range 20.0-200.0kg
  • height (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “OP05 Height (cm)” - Answer must be in range 100-250cm
  • ethnicity (django.db.models.IntegerField) – “OP06 ethnicity”
  • blood_group (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “OP07 blood group”

OrganPerson blood_group choices

clean()[source]¶

Clears date_of_birth if unknown is flagged. Clears date_of_death if unknown is flagged. Error if date_of_death is in the future (OPv02). Error if date_of_death is before date_of_birth (OPv03)

bmi_value¶

Calculated BMI based on stored height and weight information. Uses http://www.nhs.uk/chq/Pages/how-can-i-work-out-my-bmi.aspx?CategoryID=51 for formula

Returns:BMI value (or None)
Return type:float
age_from_dob¶

Determines a person’s age from their Date of Birth, compared initially against a Date of Death (if it exists), or against the current date if not applicable.

Returns:age in years as a whole number, if date of birth is known, otherwise None
Return type:int
is_recipient¶

Determine if a recipient record is linked to this person

Returns:True if recipient link exists
Return type:bool
is_donor¶

Determine if a donor record is linked to this person

Returns:True if donor link exists
Return type:bool
is_alive¶

If no date of death is known, then presume person is alive.

Returns:True if date_of_death is unknown
Return type:bool
worksheet¶

Looks for the first sample worksheet linked to this person

Returns:Samples.Worksheet object, or None
Return type:wp4.samples.models.worksheet
exception DoesNotExist¶
exception OrganPerson.MultipleObjectsReturned¶
OrganPerson.bloodsample_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

OrganPerson.created_by¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

OrganPerson.donor¶

Accessor to the related object on the reverse side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

place.restaurant is a ReverseOneToOneDescriptor instance.

class wp4.compare.models.core.RetrievalTeam(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Lookup class for the preset Retrieval Team list. Doesn’t inherit from VersionControlMixin as this is primarily a preset list of data, with helper functions attached.

Parameters:
  • id (django.db.models.AutoField) – “ID”
  • created_on (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “created on”
  • created_by_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “created by” - User account for the person logged in when this record was made/updated
  • centre_code (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “RT01 centre code” - Value must be in the range 10-99
  • based_at_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “RT02 base hospital”
based_at¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

next_sequence_number(is_online=True)[source]¶

Return the next available sequence number, taking into account that the donor must already be linked to a randomisation record, and thus we’re able to deduce if this is an online or offline case.

Param:is_online: bool. Are we looking for the online or the offline sequence
Returns:Next free number in a linear sequence
Return type:int
get_randomisation_list(is_online=True)[source]¶

Returns the id of the relevant randomisation list for the location of this team

Parameters:is_online – True, select from the online lists. False, select from the offline lists
Returns:Number matching one of the LIST_CHOICE constants
Return type:int
name¶

Human readable name for the retrieval team

Returns:(Centre Code) Team Location Description
Return type:str
based_in_country¶
exception DoesNotExist¶
class RetrievalTeam.Hospital(*args, **kwargs)¶

Simple helper class to hold information related to the various project and non-project locations. Currently referenced from Donor, OrganAllocation, RetrievalTeam, and StaffPerson

Parameters:
  • id (django.db.models.AutoField) – “ID”
  • created_on (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “created on”
  • created_by_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “created by” - User account for the person logged in when this record was made/updated
  • version (django.db.models.PositiveIntegerField) – “version” - Internal tracking version number
  • record_locked (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “record locked” - Not presently implemented or used
  • name (django.db.models.CharField) – “HO01 hospital name”
  • country (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “HO02 country”
  • is_active (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “HO03 is active” - Not presently used/implemented. For legacy data when a location closes for use
  • is_project_site (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “HO04 is project site”

parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.
